title: Rick Wurzbacher Live Feat. Joey DeFrancesco
description:
Rick Wurzbacher Live Feat. Joey DeFrancesco

Guitarist Rick Wurzbacher with Joey DeFrancesco on the Hammond B-3 organ.

Tracklist:
01. The Sermon (8:06)
02. The Reverand (7:01)
03. All Blues (12:25)
04. The Champ (11:21)
05. Lenny (5:48)
06. Champagne Glass Blues (11:10)
07. Mac Tough (10:52)

Total Time: 66:46

Personnel:
- Rick Wurzbacher, guitar
- Joey DeFrancesco, organ, trumpet (All Blues)
- Bertell Knox, drums

Released: 2003
Label: Top Shelf Jazz

Format: MP3 320 kbit/s. All songs are tagged by the book.

---------------------

Rick Wurzbacher live with very special guest 'The Incredible Joey DeFrancesco' on the B-3 organ. This album was recorded live at Blues Alley, Georgetown DC on July 30, 2001. There are many significant features about this CD; Rick goes into the audience and borrows a patron's champagne glass and uses it as a slide on the guitar. Joey plays the organ, bass lines, and trumpet all at the same time. Bertell Knox plays incredible percussion at the age of 74. This album was mixed and produced at Racetrack Sound Studios' Les Paul Control Room by Paul Chiacchierini and Rick Wurzbacher. Mastering was completed at John Oram's Analogue Barn in Meopham, Kent, England, by John Oram 'The Father of British EQ', assisted by Dave Cherry and Ash Phipps using the patented British Analogue Mastering technique with Maximum Saturation Technology.
